unnormalised: **Load Shedding Intensifies Across South India Amidst Peak Demand**
normalised: **load shedding intensifies across south india amidst peak demand**

unnormalised: Chennai, October 26 – Scheduled power outages, commonly referred to as load shedding, have intensified across several districts in Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, and Andhra Pradesh this week. Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation (TANGEDCO) officials cite unprecedented peak demand, fuelled by rising temperatures and pre-Diwali festivities, as the primary cause.
normalised: chennai, october twenty six – scheduled power outages, commonly referred to as load shedding, have intensified across several districts in tamil nadu, karnataka, and andhra pradesh this week. tamil nadu generation and distribution corporation (T A N G E D C O) officials cite unprecedented peak demand, fuelled by rising temperatures and pre-diwali festivities, as the primary cause.

unnormalised: Several industrial areas in Coimbatore and Tiruppur are reportedly facing disruptions, with factories reporting production losses. Residential areas are also experiencing 2-hour power cuts during peak evening hours.
normalised: several industrial areas in coimbatore and tiruppur are reportedly facing disruptions, with factories reporting production losses. residential areas are also experiencing two-hour power cuts during peak evening hours.

unnormalised: Karnataka Power Corporation Limited (KPCL) confirmed that a technical malfunction at the Raichur Thermal Power Station (RTPS) has further exacerbated the situation. Andhra Pradesh Southern Power Distribution Company Limited (APSPDCL) is urging consumers to conserve energy.
normalised: karnataka power corporation limited (K P C L) confirmed that a technical malfunction at the raichur thermal power station (R T P S) has further exacerbated the situation. andhra pradesh southern power distribution company limited (A P S P D C L) is urging consumers to conserve energy.

unnormalised: The outages have particularly impacted small businesses and households preparing for the upcoming Diwali celebrations. Many are lamenting the challenges of making sweets, including traditional Diwali treats and even biryani, without reliable electricity. Authorities have promised to restore normalcy within 48 hours.
normalised: the outages have particularly impacted small businesses and households preparing for the upcoming diwali celebrations. many are lamenting the challenges of making sweets, including traditional diwali treats and even biryani, without reliable electricity. authorities have promised to restore normalcy within forty eight hours.
